isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 2000, 4000, 8000 - ELECTRONIC ENGINES, CUMMINS M11E AND N14E - DESCRIPTION - On-Board Diagnostics

svcproc.title: On-Board Diagnostics
svcproc.para: The CELECT system has a built-in diagnostic capability which alerts the driver of a system problem while the engine is running.

The "yellow" Engine Warning Light (not to be confused with the red Oil/Water Warning Light) will turn on to warn the driver of an active component or system fault. While it indicates a failure has happened, the vehicle can be operated safely. The vehicle should be serviced to solve the problem, and the situation is not considered an emergency.
A lighted "red" Stop Engine Light indicates a major CELECT system problem and the vehicle should be stopped and engine shut down as soon as is safely possible.
With the key on and engine off and with the Diagnostic switch off, the indicator lights will come on for two seconds and turn off as a system test.
Refer to TROUBLESHOOTING Charts for additional diagnostic information.
